entry.title: Albian Ajeti set for Celtic return as injury blows Sturm Graz chance

entry.title: Scottish Premiership attendance record to be broken as Neil Doncaster hails 'hugely encouraging' figures

entry.title: Ange Postecoglou irked by Celtic scrutiny talk as boss turns deaf ear with 'doesn't penetrate' retort

entry.title: Wild Wednesday: Forget Hearts-Aberdeen Euro battle or Rangers farewells, the Mecca of Madness takes centre stage once more
entry.summary: The City of Discovery. Famous for its jute, jam and journalism. The home of the V&A and the Beano. Experts in construction of whaling ships which earned Dundee its aforementioned moniker. Cultural touchstones and institutions which are rightly celebrated but no longer should they act as the city's biggest attractions. They have to take a backseat. A backseat to the Mecca of Madness that continues to unfold on Tannadice Street and the two clubs separated by a couple of hundred metres.

entry.title: Fran Alonso: Forget title, Celtic changed Scottish women's football
entry.summary: Fran Alonso has told his players that they have changed the landscape of Scottish womenâ€™s football despite failing to land a first SWPL title this season.There was heartbreak for Celtic after they came within two minutes of winning their inaugural league with an emotional Alonso left to console his visibly distraught players in the aftermath of an afternoon when they were so near yet so far.
